intro: Alomia ballotifolia, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, yellow-orange flower clusters that bloom in late summer to early fall. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine, silky hairs. Alomia ballotifolia thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas.
